availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Walter Cleary (Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney, representative, and diplomat)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney, representative, and diplomat. Son of John R. Cleary and Mary Ann Connell Cleary. Married to Ann Wherritt in Harrison County in 1852. Father of Walter W. Cleary, Sallie Morrison Cleary, Edwin Cleary, William Steele Cleary, Jacob Cleary. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1849. Admitted to the Kentucky Bar in 1852. Attorney in Cynthiana, Harrison County, in 1852. Attorney of Harrison County Court from 1856 to 1860. Represented Harrison County in the Kentucky General Assembly from 1859 to 1861. Served in Confederate States Army (C.S.A.). United States diplomat to the Bermudas and Canada until 1865. Served as secretary in legation for Confederate states in Canada in partnership with [Unknown] Thompson and C.C. Clay.

ab.bibl:
E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry and Modern Activities, Vol. II (New York: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), 681.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison, Cynthiana, p. 575.
Find A Grave, "William Walter Cleary (September 13, 1831- March 16, 1897)," Memorial #1556053434, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=156053434&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).
